citeinfo.origin: Minnesota Geological Survey, modified by MNDNR, Lands and Minerals
citeinfo.title: Bedrock Geology from MGS State Map Series S-20 2000 (Digital Version 3) - Line

descript.abstract:
Bedrock Geology of Minnesota, compiled by G.B. Morey and Joyce Meints, 2000. This is the digital version of the Minnesota Geological Survey State Map Series S-20 (Geologic Map of Minnesota: Bedrock Geology), 3rd edition. Scale is 1:1,000,000.
The 1st edition was done by G.B. Morey, 1994. The 2nd edition was revised in 1996.
The Arc/INFO coverage, bgpg2000, was downloaded from the MGS ftp site by DNR, Division of Lands and Minerals, in the fall of 2000. To make the coverage match the DNR's GIS core library, it was renamed to bg2kxpy2 and projected into UTM, extended zone 15, NAD83, units meters, from the Lambert projection it was created in. Several additional attributes were added to the coverage?s attribute table to enable users to see more of the information that was included on the map created by MGS, specifically, the detailed legend descriptions and the correlation of map units. This information was not included in the digital data that is available for download. These additional attributes will be described more fully in the Lineage and Entity and Attribute sections.
descript.purpose: To produce a general descriptive layer of bedrock geology for the state.

timeperd.current: Map was delineated in 1994, and revised as of July 1, 1996, based on the subsurface information available at the time. This version, October 1999 - October 2000 includes the addition of recent geologic data and recompilation of state bedrock geology by the MGS authors.

idinfo.accconst: Not for distribution beyond the DNR.
idinfo.useconst: Credit given to Minnesota Geological Survey

browse.browsen: http://jmaps.dnr.state.mn.us/gis/dp_datasample.jsp?mpid=39000178&ptid=2&fcid=2&lname=Bedrock Geology from MGS State Map Series S-20 2000 (Digital Version 3) - Line

horizpa.horizpar: Source layer bg2kxpy2: The horizontal error complies with national map accuracy standards at 1:1,000,000, approx. 500 meters.
